summary:
As an experienced SAP consultant in the Logistics domain (SD, MM) I have contributed to several succesful implementations in the last 18 years.
I have worked in projects ranging from major ERP transitions to smaller enhancements to get more out of existing systems.
My experience is mainly in industries with fast moving goods.

Specialties: Business Consulting, SAP, Sales and Distribution SD, Materials Management MM & Project management.

profile_positions.description:
In this project a full transformation of the core ERP systems would be executed. The client would move from an AS/400 system, linked to several other smaller applications, to SAP for ERP, ATG for eCommerce and Manhattan for Warehouse management. 

Noud started as a SAP Subject Matter Expert during the Plan phase of the project, followed by leading the Master data team during the Design, Build, Test and Deploy phases for the first release of the project.

Due to the release-driven project delivery the Noud was also responsible for safeguarding the integration of SAP into the end state system landscape in order to prevent rework in later stages of the project.

Responsibilities and tasks:
-	Defining scope and solution for the implementation of the SAP Logistics domain
-	Determining required budget, resources and planning for the first release of the project
-	Creating detailed project plan for Master Data
-	Measuring and monitoring progress and quality of delivery
-	Reporting to Program Management
-	Mitigating Risks and Issues.
-	Lead workshops to define (SAP) detailed functional design
-	Review and correct SAP configuration.

Results:
-	First release for Master Data was within budget and on time.
-	Only few issues appeared in the MD domain after go-live, none of these issues disrupted the business. The department responsible for Master Data, was able to process data in the same speed already shortly after go-live even though the change was quite significant for them. This was to a great extend related to the efforts Noud put into involving the client in an early stage, training and support during and after go-live.
profile_positions.title: Subject matter expert SAP logistics and Team lead Master data

profile_positions.description:
This assignment concerned delivering a feasibility study that would give insight into the benefits of  either a SAP or Oracle template system implementation for the European branch of the company. The new ERP system would replace their existing outdated mainframe solution.

Noud was the expert for the SAP side of the study, focusing on:
-	Assessing feasibility of the scenario based on SAP.
-	Defining  high level business cases for each option.
-	Proposing the best option for implementation.

Scope:
- Order-to-cash
- Purchase-to-pay
- Material replenishment
- Finance.
-  Regions South, Benelux / DACH, UK/Ireland and France.

Responsibilities and tasks:
-	Identify stakeholders and conduct interviews to determine key business objectives
-	Determine business and system requirements
-	Execute fit/gap analysis between requirements and system capabilities
-	Coordinate system vendors with regards to presenting a demo and response (Request for Proposal) on fit with requirements.

Results: 
- Software vendors delivered a 1-day demo and presentation based on the processes and requirements defined by the  Noud.
- A proposal for implementation was created. Noud  documented and presented the SWOT analysis of the possible implementation solutions. More specifically he defined the required SAP implementation effort and implementation steps.
profile_positions.title: Subject matter expert SAP

profile_positions.description:
The existing system that supported the processes of the department of Network Connections was end-of-life and needed to be replaced. This project was initiated to redesign the business processes and implement a SAP system to support these processes.

Nouds role within the project was SD/MM Consultant. He designed and built the processes involving Sales / Purchase Orders and Billing. Furthermore he ensured integration with the rest of the Build team (CS, Portal, ABAP) with regards to the overall concept.

Activities:
-	Create functional designs , describing the new way of working.
-	Set up system according to design process and configuration  in SAP SD and MM.
-	Build and test SAP SD and SAP MM configuration
-	Support test and perform issue resolution during UAT and After Go live.

Results: 
-	The design and build proved to be a solid solution during testing and deployment.
-	the SD/mm solution integrated well with other parts of the system landscape (custom built portal and mobile devices) via interfaces that updated the Sales order flows in SAP. Almost all interface messages could be processed automatically without user intervention.
-	The client expressed much appreciation for the efforts Noud put into working with and handing over the project information to the Support organization. This gave the people confidence and enabled them to actually support the new solution.
profile_positions.title: SAP Consultant Sales and Distribution & Materials Management

profile_positions.description:
After the merger the Order to Cash processes of the previously separate companies needed to be consolidated in order to act as one company to the customers. This project had as goal to facilitate commercial integration of the Cheese & Butter groups of the two organizations and act as one towards customers per June 1st  2009. 

Project Objectives:
- Integrated OTC processes on one SAP platform for Cheese respectively for Butter.
- Merged product and customer database.
- Harmonized price book.
- Temporary solutions for controlling good flows between non-integrated sourcing plants and customers through so-called Third Party Order (TPO) scenario's.
- Technical Integration of the Logistics Service Provider.
- Temporary control structures to safeguard the overall integrity of the goods-/ money-flow between sales, delivery and customer.

Nouds role in the project was Lead Order to Cash Consultant with the responsibilities/tasks:
- Project management of OTC part of the project.
- Reporting on progress of (technical) designs, build, and technical tests.
- Design of the TPO process and TPO order interface.
- Supervise and assess junior consultants

Activities:
- Create functional designs that describe the process and required configuration to fulfill an order from plants from both 'brands'.
- Create designs for the required interfaces
- Build system according to designs
- Test and issue resolution 
- Develop and deliver end user training.

Results: 
- Impact for the customers was limited to changing their EDI messaging to customers.
- Personnel of the order desk had little problems adjusting to the new system and way of working due to solid configuration and explanation of the new system.
- Billing was done in a consolidated manner for all brands that belong to this business unit of the new company.

profile_positions.description:
This project was part of a global template roll out for ERP systems.
Implementations of this template were done per Business Group (BG).This project involved the BG for Nutritional Products, one of the biggest BG within the company. 
The scope was to implement all template business processes:
-	Order To Cash (OTC)
-	Purchase to Pay (PtP)
-	Finance and Controlling (FICO)
-	Plant Maintenance (PM)

and the Business specific business processes which were not covered by the template:
-	Integral demand & Supply Chain Planning (DSCM)
-	Production execution (PP)
-	Quality Management (QM)
-	Warehouse Management (WM)
-	Project Systems (PS)
-	Prospect to Order (PTO)

Nouds role within the project was: SAP Consultant for the domain Order to Cash and Purchase to Pay.
He assisted with the definition of the functional requirements, carried out the technical customization of the system, updated the system documentation (both functional and technical and assisted the key users with executing the testing.
Furthermore Noud takes the lead in the development of changes to the template. This means coordination of all people involved and reporting progess to the Project Management.
Additionally Noud took upon him to:
-	Identify gaps between local requirements and template solution
-	Determine possible solutions (including writing and coordinating Change requests)
-	Fulfill the role of liaison between corporate IT and local it and business users

Results: 
-	Noud defined solutions that both did not impact template heavily and also could be implemented with little effort on the local business unit.
-	Noud was an important linking pin between the local operating company and corporate ICT. He facilitated meetings to discuss solutions and resolve (communication) issues between the local team and the corporate IT team.

profile_positions.description:
The project was a part of a larger programme to roll out a global template SAP system. Implementations of this template were done per Business Group. This project was the second roll-out within the business group Pharmaceutical Products. The first implementation was in 2003 in Greenville, NC USA.

The scope of the project was to implement the SAP template business processes:
- Order To Cash (OTC)
- Purchase to Pay (PtP)
- Finance and Controlling (FICO)
- Plant Maintenance (PM)

and the business group specific processes (not part of the template configuration):
- Quality Management (QM)
- Warehouse Management (WM)
- Production
- Project Systems (PS)

Nouds role within the project is SAP Consultant for the domain Order to Cash.
SAP Consultants assisted with the definition of the functional requirements, carried out the technical customization of the system, updated the system documentation (both functional and technical) and assisted the key users with executing the testing.
Additionally he:
- Explained global template processes and system configuration to local business users.
- Identified gaps and corresponding solutions. These could be local workarounds, local developments or changes to the global template system.
- Created interfaces designs for integration with existing local systems
- Trained end users
- Delivered	 After go-live support

Results: 
- No significant changes to the template were required because Noud defined workable work-arounds and could explain the rationale behind the global template. When changes to the template were required, Noud could define a solution that benefit the template, also for other business groups.
- Local developments were kept to a minimum, but still fulfilled all local requirements. This supported the goal of the company to reduce IT maintenance costs and at the same time contributed to the corporate IT strategy to have 1 global consolidated ERP system.
